message.content:
{"id": "12906", 
"title": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened", 
"description": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)", 
"OB": "1. Open a Java file in the workbench.
2. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
3. No warning or error message is displayed.", 
"EB": "1. Ensure that a Windows editor is associated with the Java file.
2. Open a Java file in the workbench.
3. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
4. The workbench should display a warning message indicating that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes, and prompt to confirm the action.
5. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all files need to be closed before opening in another editor.", 
"SR": "1. Associate a Windows editor with the Java file if not already done.
2. Open a Java file in the workbench.
3. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
4. Verify that the workbench displays a warning message or error message when trying to open the file in another editor if it is already opened."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12906', 'title': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)', 'description': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg) ', 'OB': "Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': "Make sure you have an assoicate Windows editor for your java file.Ifnot, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and selectWordPad or notepadas default editor for all java files.In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java fileOpen With ..System Editor.A notepad and wordpad window will pop up with the javafile opened. Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. "}
